column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////Kugelhopf is a traditional bakery item in Central Europe and resembles marble cake
column2: in an adorably small bundt-like form. The Kugelhopf was dusted with sugar
column3: and it definitely caught my eye. It also consists of almonds and raisins
column4: and I don't particularly like raisins . I think that if I liked raisins
column5: I wouldn't have had much of a problem with it
column6: because it was small and light
column7: but the bits of raisins I'd find throughout the pastry didn't sit well with me. While it wasn't my favorite treat
column8: I'm still glad I tried it and now know what it is.
